website_summaries.verdict: One of the toughest polarizing lens filters on the market, but you'll pay a bit extra for this quality.
pros: Uses a nano-coating to resist scratches and other imperfections to the filter's surface, while also making it easier to clean
Fits numerous lens threads ranging from 30.5 mm to 86 mm
Front thread allows you to add more filters or accessories
Uses lightweight materials, so it won't hamper your photography work
cons: Some customers report receiving filters that don't include the authenticity sticker

customer_reviews.title: I got fake one. Be aware.
customer_reviews.text: I got fake one. It was lucky to find out. If I didnt read reviews before I purchase I might be fooled. Be aware. Also the box looks very cheap and fake made in China. No authentication sealing, not in the outer box or inner case. I'm very disappointed. I'm returning it back and reorder one more time hoping they send me genuine B+W this time.
customer_reviews.author: Shabti

customer_reviews.title: Fake. Exercise extreme caution when buying any BW filter on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Owning many BW filters, it took me all of 3 seconds of opening the box to see this was a counterfeit filter. I reported it to Amazon but everyone should be warned of the extreme high risk of buying BW filters here now. It's such a bad knock off, they didn't even bother to fake the low-profile nature of it. Honestly, this is some lazy counterfeit work here. White lettering, not well placed. I'm sure at the Local 211 Countefeiters Guild, this kind of sloppy work would get them kicked out. TLDR: EXERCISE EXTREME CAUTION WHEN BUYING ANY BW FILTERS HERE.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Ung

customer_reviews.title: great product!!
customer_reviews.text: have been having issues find a usable cpl for my sony16-35 fe f4 on my sony a7rII been through tiffen premium, super dull color and strange yellowish hue. Hoya hrt, combo cpl/uv that gave super heavy vignetting and dull colors, finally found the B+W 72mm XS-Pro HTC Kaesemann that is amazing!! fantastic clarity, beautiful color representation, great glare cut and no vignetting what so ever!!! not cheap but when you have a great camera and a fantastic lens and you put a crappy filter on it you make the whole thing a crappy combo. your images are never better than the glass you use!
customer_reviews.author: grippla kukalapiTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: ... test at my optical store and the results were amazing. I can say this filer is well made ...
customer_reviews.text: I had doubts if i bought the right filter and since i am optician and know how lenses are coated and made i tested it my own professional way The lens was well made and well coated i can say its flawless and i also did a polarizing test at my optical store and the results were amazing. I can say this filer is well made and i tested it on my lens the results were astonishing. Here couple of picture i have took ... enjoy and buy this filter
customer_reviews.author: Wael kassab

customer_reviews.title: FAKE B+W product. Stay away from this seller!
customer_reviews.text: This is FAKE B+W filter. The product photos of my review tells everything. The filter feels much lighter than authentic one. The package looks cheap. The inscription is lightly printed on the filter. The side looks unevenly shaped. Overall is a crap! STAY AWAY! I am so angry. Being fooled by the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Su Tan

customer_reviews.title: A handy circular polarizer with only 1-1.5 f-stop loss in light.
customer_reviews.text: Read about this polarizer in Pop. Photography magazine. The feature that attracted me to it was relatively small 1-1.5 f-stop loss for a polarizer. I have before used polarizers on cameras and was always disappointed by the 2-3 f-stop loss. I used this polarizer on a recent trip to Peru and was satisfied with its ability to "pop" blue skies and reduce reflections on various backgrounds. Given its relatively small light loss, I left it on all day and also used it in low light situations which would would have been unthinkable before. One adjustment I made was to increase the ISO by one f-stop to compensate for indoor shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Deebz

customer_reviews.title: Not good for ultra wide angle lenses.
customer_reviews.text: The picture was taken with a Laowa 12mm lens on a full frame camers. The thickenss of this B+w filter is more which creates heavy vignetting on all for corners. If you intend to use the polirazer for ultra wide angle lens consider a much thinner filter like the Nikon 95mm Circular Polarizing Filter II availabe at
customer_reviews.author: Vivek S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Filter For The Price.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a lesser expensive filter on Amazon previously. You get what you pay for and had to return it for issues. This lens however was spot on focus wise at farious focal lengths using a Tamron 150-600, G2 from the very first use. The filter came nicely packaged and was very clean. I have threaded an UV filter over this lens. The lens cap and lens hood have no issues fitting with the filters. The filter looks to be built well and threads off and on nicely from the lens. For a not cheap and not super expensive option, you may desire examining this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Lion 365

customer_reviews.title: On first use, B+W 82mm XS-Pro HTC got stuck on
customer_reviews.text: Despite gently finger tightening B+W 82mm XS-Pro HTC CPL filter only enough to be able to turn polarize without unscrewing filter, the filter seized up (got stuck on). Never before have had a filter seize up like this one. As expensive as filter is, I would expect it never to seize when gently finger tightened. Filter needs to be redesigned to where threads are anti-seize or threaded flange is easier to grip or both!
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Two units, both failed
customer_reviews.text: This CPL binds and binds badly. My gear is kept pristine, carried in too many cases for the sake of my back, and further, the second one bound before I put it on my lens. I get that it is made so that a pinch on the edge will make it so you can take it off the lens, but it doesn't work. A few turns and it got tight. A few more and it became impossible. One filter, I can understand a manufacturing glitch or QC goof. Two? I'm beginning to see a patter. Look online to see if it's a coincidence? Yup. In multiples. Definitely a pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Kdub

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Polarizer
customer_reviews.text: Totally destroys the Hoya HMC PL-CIR (which I also own). The B+W is sharper. I suspect the B+W has better light transmission because it looks a lot brighter through the viewfinder and shoots a stop faster. It's also less picky when shooting wide. The Hoya has a bad habit of polarizing one side of the frame (dark sky) while the other side of the frame is isn't (bright sky). This is somewhat expected when shooting wide, because your picture covers 180 degrees of sky - the polarization angle in respect to the sun is different on one side vs. the other. However, the B+W seems to cope better in this situation, allowing more polarization before the disparity becomes unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Received used and damaged, could be a fake
customer_reviews.text: I received a used filter which had dust, finger prints, and damage to the threads. The security seals were broken. As other people have reviewed, there is no way for me to validate this is a real b+w filter.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to test this polarizer as it delivered, sadly it's a cloudly day but still a small part of blue sky. I have the comparesion with and without polarizer, you can find the attached picture. This polarizer is very well built, it's very thin so you won't get any dark on the corner, like someone was worry about in Q&A, when using ultra wide angel lens. And it indeed increase the contrast of the sky, the color is deeper with polarizer. I haven't get a chance to test it on reduction of refecltion lights, but I am pretty sure it will.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Chu

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for and this is #1
customer_reviews.text: I own Hoya and Tiffen and "no-name" filters. This was the first time I sprang for a high-end quality filter. I am using it on a Nikkor 10-20mm zoom wide angle lens and polarizers are notoriously tricky on wide angle lenses, so I went for the best. And I was not disappointed. This is solidly manufactured, has a very sturdy feel, and is optically excellent. No problems. This is my filter brand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the best polarizers that I have used in my 32 year photography career.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great price.  No scratches after two weeks in Utah without a lens cap!
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a Canon 750D and used it for a two month trip through the sandy desert southwest of Utah, Arizona, and California. Held up wonderfully, and greatly enhanced pictures of the red rocks and blue skies. Also took the brunt of the abuse from the sand - did not scratch at all, despite me losing my lens cap for two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made, acts as a 1-stop ND filter.  Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying these circular polarizers out. To be honest I don't see much difference between circular and stationary as far a image quality is concerned. However, this particular model results in only a 1-stop loss of light and acts as a reduced ND filter. For these reasons, I do recommend using this polarizer filter for landscape shooting. Also, these are well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: G. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: The filter is very good! As advertised, there is very little decrease in the light passing through the filter, and the polarizing effect is consistent and easy to control without affecting color balance either. This is my first B+W filter, but it has noticeably better construction than another brand's filters that I have tried. I would absolutely recommend this to any photographer!
customer_reviews.author: DHTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A "Must Have" for outdoor photography
customer_reviews.text: Starting as a hobby in the late '70s and now, since 2012, as my business, I'm shooting ~60k photos/year, 99.99% outdoors. A "CPL"/Circular Polarizer Filter IS a "Must Have". In the past, I used cheap Hoya filters. Some worked fine, others were stiff in spots despite hundreds of thousands of photos. When I got my Pentax K-1, I also upgraded my CPL. B+W has a well earned reputation. Only recently, with ~75k photos using the K-1, has it had moments of stiffness, requiring me to take the lens hood off to adjust it. (I don't have strong hands.) 99% of the time, it spins freely and I'm very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Krepps

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, very thin ring.
customer_reviews.text: Very slim filter. Seems to work well with my Sony RX-10 M3. It's slim, so it doesn't vignette even when I stacked it on the UV Haze filter. Be careful not to tighten it too much, as it's thin and give very little to grip to remove it. It's very thin, so if you're using a lens hood, its difficult to get a finger on it to rotate the filter to achieve the desired affect. Overall it's good and I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the telephoto lens of my old Nikon D60. I was going on a 3 week road/camping trip to southern Utah and was warned that cheaper CPLs create problems with telephotos (I have a cheaper Promaster CPL on my wide angle that works just fine). This worked great. No issues with threading while putting it on or taking it off. My camera was used and abused but no scratches on the lens. Really makes a difference taking landscape photos of colorful rocks against bright blue skies. I would definitely buy again from B+W.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but a tiny loss of sharpness
customer_reviews.text: I love this circular polarizer on my Sigma 105mm Art f1.4. However, I have noticed that there is a slight loss of sharpness when using this. I am okay with the trade-off since you will have to compare the pictures side by side to tell the difference.
customer_reviews.author: MRK

customer_reviews.title: excellent, worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Tiffen polarizer with the BW, and it is vastly superior. Little or no vignette on a FE sony-zeiss 16-35 lens used for landscape photography. It also comes with a smaller hit on F stops. The Tiffen created a very dark vignette which needed heavy correction or crop - nothing of the kind with the BW filter. This is a huge win and totally worth the price. Very happy! Linking a pic that is straight off camera with no post.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas M

customer_reviews.title: Great filter by B&W.
customer_reviews.text: Just received and took some great pictures of some boats in the bayou. The clouds pop and the sky is real blue. Very happy with this filter. It cost almost $100, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: David Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Love B&W filters, a quality product. My only complaint is that the 58mm does not screw directly onto the Exmor lens of my Sony HX400V which takes 58mm filters. The filter does screw in nicely to a 58mm Nikon lens. The B&W will screw into Hoya clear UV filter which screws into the Exmor lens with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: KMC

customer_reviews.title: Essential daytime shooting gear.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for daylight shooting. Wipes glare of the sun right out and turns washed out clouds into very dramatic detailed sculpture like forms. In post production, blue skies pop and are not washed out from sun's harsh glare. If you shoot in the middle of the day.... You really should have one. It's a not for every occasion filter.... But for daytime and experimental abstract work... It's a must.
customer_reviews.author: Will-Can

customer_reviews.title: Beware of used warehouse purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these used through Amazon warehouse and they both had scratches on the inside of the lens. Inspect your used lens upon receiving or just get a new one. Otherwise the lens works very well.
customer_reviews.author: matthew herman

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding polarizing filter in all respects, just need to practice practice now that the rain has gone by. This product is highly recommended; get it from Amazon.com .....
customer_reviews.author: Arnold T. Serrata "Nolo Serrata"

customer_reviews.title: WOW - I considered a Tiffen and am glad I stepped up my game
customer_reviews.text: WOW - I considered a Tiffen and am glad I stepped up my game. This baby is the bomb!!! Quality is surpassed only by $200+ competitors as I compared it to my brother-in-law's Lee Polarizing Filter. This is the best bang for the buck out there if you are shopping for a CP and do not want to spend a ridiculous amount of cash while realizing that a $33 CP is not nearly going to give you the results you want. What are your photos worth? Skip a couple cups of Starbucks and do it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cronin

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: My favorite polarizer. I have other cheaper one, now I know the difference in quality. Update= have had for 6 months and the lens fell out of the metal ring and now it doesn't stay in. Bummer I finally get a better one and now it useless
customer_reviews.author: J. Mukka

customer_reviews.title: B+W - THERE IS NO SUBSTITUTE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this filter for my Canon 85mm lens. What a great buy! I previously bought one for my 50mm and when it performed better than any other filter, I new my next one and others thereafter would be B+W. These filters are made with brass threads, heavy right out of the box. You can feel AND see the difference immediately. This filter does not slow the focus down when you focus in auto or otherwise. Colors are brighter, blues are bluer, greens are greener and clouds are gorgeous. This filter can be cleaned easily with no smearing. They're more expensive and definitely worth it! B+W - there is no substitute!
customer_reviews.author: CHI MOMTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This is a genuine B+W product.
customer_reviews.text: I was mostly concerned about the authenticity since I received a fake one for the 77mm lens , but this circular polarizer filter is genuine. I have attached some pictures which prove it. It was sealed it has the classic B+W don't design.It was sealed inside the box as well and when you feel it off you see a unique ID by Schneider optics. I am happy😄.
customer_reviews.author: Deathstroke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is an outstanding piece of glass. Everything about it is great, from the glass to the ring to the threads. And you don't lose two stops either. This is a tad costly, but worth it. If you're on the fence, but can swing the extra few bucks, buy it. You won't regret it or question its quality.
customer_reviews.author: RicM

customer_reviews.title: Great performance. If you are looking to eliminate reflections ...
customer_reviews.text: Great performance. If you are looking to eliminate reflections off glass, a polarizing lens works well for reflections at an angle, but not looking straight into the glass at 90 degrees. A note with the lens said it contained lead and cadmium in the glass at a level which exceeds Chinese standard SJ/T 11363-2006. That standard allows lead up to 0.1% and cadmium up to 0.01%.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend if You are Looking for a Circular Polarizer
customer_reviews.text: This filter is amazing. There are absolutely no issues with the glass. There is no distortion or any other issues. As soon as you take this out of the case you can immediately feel the quality. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a circular polarizer. Don't waste your money on cheaper versions.
customer_reviews.author: EinsteinTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This is a good polarizing filter
customer_reviews.text: Just bought an expensive, well $$$$ to me, zoom lens for landscape photography and needed a polarizing filter. I spent everything on the lens so can't afford ND and gradient filters yet, but still want to shoot photos with new lens. I bought this because of the reviews and it has lived up to them. It fit perfectly on the lens and doesn't change the color much. Definitely would buy it again. It's a little more expensive than others, but with photography equipment you usually get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Living Large

customer_reviews.title: Clear and high quality for the $
customer_reviews.text: Really great polarizing without much light reduction. Super clear across entire field. I hesitated to put on such a big lens, worrying about loss of clarity, but was pleased that clarity is well maintained with this polarizer. For the money, it is top quality. Beware anything less expensive if you want clarity and good light transmission and still have proper polarization.
customer_reviews.author: MrBass

customer_reviews.title: Image quality dropped down
customer_reviews.text: The quality of my photo dropped down tremendously, a lot of noise during the good light condition. I’ve read that some people got a fake lense, I’m not sure about it with mine, but I returned mine anyway. I expected wow effect after using it, but not this poor image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lilia Kozlova

customer_reviews.title: Frozen Stiff
customer_reviews.text: This filter would have been great but I could not get it to turn. It was mot merely stiff but frozen. However, the dealer was honest and issued my refund as soon as I returned the filter.
customer_reviews.author: budgiehawk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality - great pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Bought before I went on a summer vacation to Florida. I set up a helicopter tour around Cocoa Beach during my trip, so I wanted a good polarizer filter. I thought about getting a more basic filter, but decided to just spend the extra money and get this one. I'm happy I did. It easily screwed on to my Panasonic FZ1000 camera, and the pictures are turning out great! Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Oops on the quality control of build.
customer_reviews.text: The filter rotates fine when not on lens. Once mounted. The two sections do not rotate. There is a binding action. Feels there may be a bur of brass in between. I have used and own many filters over 40 years of photography to know the diiference in quality. This is a fluk. Glass quality is clear and does it's job..
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Davis

customer_reviews.title: Paid $99.00 for a Counterfeit lens!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just realized. That I paid $ 99. 00 for a Counterfeit filter!!! White writing instead of brass!!!!!! Very aggravated.
customer_reviews.author: L VanS

customer_reviews.title: Only Brand I will Buy
customer_reviews.text: I own several B+W XS-Pro HTC Kaesemann Circular Polarizer filters, it is the only ones I will use. The quality of these filters is excellent, they are made of brass to help prevent them from binding with the camera lens. The glass that is used is of optical quality, some manufacturers us plain glass. I highly recommend B+W filters.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it.
customer_reviews.text: Have tried to get this stupid filter off my camera for a month finely I did but now.....
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: Affects image quality compared to my Breaktrough CPL
customer_reviews.text: Is NOT a bad filter but it was affecting the IQ of my 105mm 1.4 Art lens where my Breakthrough CPL X4 was not so I sold the B+W and kept the Breakthrough instead. I found the B+W on sale so I gave it a shot to see if I could save some money.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gabriel G.

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my Filter
customer_reviews.text: Ruined my filter. Went on, but would not come off. Also froze up and would not twist.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Another fake chinese garbage filter.
customer_reviews.text: Box was a hilarious joke, not even close to B+W's box. The filter was opened, scratched, used, and returned probably NUMEROUS times. Send this crap garbage back to China and STOP selling worthless crap on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchase

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: This changed my photography game. Woul highly recommend for automotive photographers! There's a little bit of a learning curve but it's so worth it. The quality of the item is great. The only concern I have is that since it's so slim, it's going to be challenging to take off my lens if I ever need to. For now, I don't plan to.
customer_reviews.author: dela

customer_reviews.title: I got fake one. Be aware.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two lens filters. I checked that one is genuine and one is a fake.
customer_reviews.author: Hoon

customer_reviews.title: Hard to turn
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like this. One stop lighter than Hoya I compared it to. Beautifully constructed, and lens cap fits fully. One fatal flaw – the ring is quite stiff to turn, exacerbated by the ring being incredibly thin. This resulted in my fingers often slipping off the ring while turning. I just know I'm going to end up with fingerprints all over the glass as a result... Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Redgum

customer_reviews.title: Great PRO Circular Polarizing Filter!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a Canon 5D Mark III . Love it. Does a great job with reflections and enhances the colors of the photos nicely for my work. Polarizing filters are essential must-have for anyone serious about photography. I use B+W only because they have a great product. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Karl R. Lamberg

customer_reviews.title: Great filter when used correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Great filter - but I just need to learn not to use it in all sunny photos or every situation with glare - since it has a tendency to leave a slight amber tint to my photos (which cannot be edited out) - even though I do try to adjust the filter before using. Very high quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Mundane

customer_reviews.title: A great polarizing filter made even better with less light loss
customer_reviews.text: A great polarizing filter made even better with less light loss. I have the original non HTC version of this filter and you can definitely see the difference right away and in your camera. The filter slides smoothly, heavyweight, and is quality machined. Make sure you get this from a legitimate seller since I had to return on that did not have the sticker seal on the inside plastic casel marked "original" on it.
customer_reviews.author: SadRobot

customer_reviews.title: Sky is darker blue and clouds really stand out while making other scenery better too. It screws on easy and rotates without ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes a huge difference in the sky! Sky is darker blue and clouds really stand out while making other scenery better too. It screws on easy and rotates without effort yet doesn't move on its own. Taking it off was a snap as well. I didn't bother trying a cheaper brand first so I can't compare it to others but you won't be disappointed in spending a bit more for the B+W brand. Quality is excellent and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Yoder

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Top notch quality. Although I don’t see the value. This CPL seems to polarize decent but I can’t stand but to think it’s effecting my picture quality. I’m not satisfied but I’ll admit I don’t have a ton of experience with CPL filters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the product
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived on time and in pristine condition. Package was completely sealed and with the authenticity stamp. Having read where other people had issues with the filter locking on to other filters or the lens I was somewhat concerned. Upon receiving the filter I immediately put it onto a UV filter. It went on very smooth and came off just as easy. I then attached it to my Nikon 24-70 lens. It attached and unattached very smoothly. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David Owles

customer_reviews.title: Great filter, built well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, very heavy duty construction, the polarizer element rotates easily within the frame ring which also has enough surface area to get a good grip on with fingers. Light drop seems small, and the D800E's auto focus doesn't seem to be impacted much or at all by the presence of the filter. Only used it with a Nikkor 24-70 2.8 so far but the results are pleasant, although adjusting the filter with the hood on is nigh impossible, but I guess I have to fault the lens for that rather than the filter.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy from Seattle

customer_reviews.title: B+W xs-pro CP filter
customer_reviews.text: B+W filter used with Panasonic Lumix FZ-1000 on outside of permanent UV filter. Minimal f-stop loss in this set up. Excellent clarity. Have not experienced any flare or glare issues. I have added and removed this from another high quality filter (Hoya) with absolutely no sticking issues. Lens cap hold on tightly even with thin profile. Surface easy to clean. Never disappointed with B+W
customer_reviews.author: G. BurnsteinTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit filter
customer_reviews.text: I received a counterfeit B+W filer. There are checklists for validating a legit B+W filter. This one failed a number of criteria.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this polarizer is great, I love it and I have nothing to complain about. I use it on my Canon 24-70 f2.8 L II USM. The only "problem" I have is that when the lens hood is mounted, it's hard put your fingers in there to rotate the polarizer while looking into the viewfinder. It's easier without lens hood, but that's up to you to decide whether you need the hood or not.
customer_reviews.author: Valentino

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Cost
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to do. The 1 to 1.5f stop loss seems to be pretty accurate which I like. Well made, screws on and off easily, no noticeable color cast or loss in picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kerryks1

customer_reviews.title: Slim Mount, great touch.
customer_reviews.text: If you know what you need, this is the CP for you. I've owned several in the past, but with the slim mount, and the smooth spin of the glass, rest assured, B+W has you covered. Would by this again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Shane  Brock

customer_reviews.title: Alway buy B&W UV Nanos
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched from Canon to Fujifilm and the switch gave me the opportunity to buy new filters for my new lens. These Nano-coated, scratch-resistant filters made from Scott glass are great. I bought a wide range of filter sizes spanning 43mm to 95mm.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: I think I got fake one too
customer_reviews.text: Just received this filter. Unlike other B+W products I ordered. This one does not have the authentication QR-Code on the box. I'm going to return and re-order it.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: Beware Quality
customer_reviews.text: Low quality. Filter was plastic and not glass. Ring was aluminum and not brass. What I got was made in China and not Germany.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: I love this. I ordered this and some cheaper colored ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I ordered this and some cheaper colored filters (didn't want to spend the money till I was sure I would use them) and I can really feel the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Beachgirl

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Fit my FZ1000. I noticed the difference right away taking pictures with this polarized filter. It improved contrast and reduced that cloudy look I had when using a UV only filter. I appreciated it did not reduce over light as much as other polarized filters.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Simon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome filter
customer_reviews.text: Was worried about receiving a fake but am more than happy that mine is genuine. Bought an 82mm and weighed in at 46 grams. Tx on filter is gold true to genuine product. Picture is taken with polarizing filter, couldn't wait to get it out the packet and try it !
customer_reviews.author: Blueangel

customer_reviews.title: Way too stiff.
customer_reviews.text: The rotating part of the filter was so stiff it was not possible to adjust it and maintain manual focus, literally unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Grasshopper on Video Forums

customer_reviews.title: Nice and bright to shoot through.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Doesnt eat too much light. Wish it had marks for vertical and 90deg alighnment of the coatings but other than that I have no issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality & Price
customer_reviews.text: B+W is quality German made filters, and despite being a newbie to the photography realm I am please at the quality and heft of this product.
customer_reviews.author: ckluh

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality filter. Blue skies and wonderful colors.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality filter and I have used it for one fall season. Its slim and sometime hard to tell if your doing anything. After purchasing this I purchased another more expensive brand at twice the cost. I didn't notice any color shifting and seemed as though the viewfinder it was a very short spot that made any difference. Remember there isn't any filter in photoshop that can do what this filter can do.
customer_reviews.author: William Hill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Filter
customer_reviews.text: I have always used and liked B+H filters. They are excellent and this polorizer is no exception. Used it on our recent trip to The Great Smoky Mountain National Park for fall scenery. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Top quality at a competitive price
customer_reviews.text: What can I say: it's B+W. There are many more choices today than when I started years ago, but between B+W and Cokin, I've never been disappointed when it came to quality filters at competitive prices. Always top quality for my hard-earned dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Homesteader

customer_reviews.title: Fits good my Canon 5D
customer_reviews.text: I wish only it was a little lower Price... Cleans very well. Finger Prints are no more a problem. Fits good my Canon 5D MKiii
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Great polarizer for my Nikon B700.
customer_reviews.text: Great filter. I had the same brand and style for my old Nikon D90 and it was great for mountain and sea coast shots. I use this one on my Nikon B700 but the threading is tricky, since the lens is not designed to accept a filter - it has only partial threading. It can be used with great care. Rotate counter-clockwise until you feel a slight click, then clockwise, but only if you feel no resistance. Trial and error plus patience.
customer_reviews.author: Bob in VA

customer_reviews.title: This is a great Polarizer
customer_reviews.text: I knew I was buying a high end polarizer, and was excited to try it out. For some reason, I assumed it would only spin so far in either direction, but this baby will spin all day long, changing the amount of light it allows in. Initially that made me worry that I couldnt easily get it off my lens, but my worries proved to be unfounded
customer_reviews.author: Swoopy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Sharp at all focal lengths (no astigmatism effects) No perceptible color shift. Very capable polarizer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Austin

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.text: Seems a quality filter to me. I don't notice any degradation in my photos. The polarization effect seems smooth and even. Can rarely be slightly difficult to remove. I have used many brands of polarizers over the years and this is among the best I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Tazio57

customer_reviews.title: Jury's Still Out
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had much time with this unit but, my initial thoughts are: it's so slim that it's difficult to rotate it. I suppose that will take time to get used to. Also, one won't notice much of a change in appearance when making adjustments. My Hoya CPF seems to provide a better visualization. It's possible that this filter is of a quality where "less is more" reigns supreme. I hope so; it wasn't cheap. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: BSlamDesi

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a polarizer that doesn't totally kill your ability ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a polarizer that doesn't totally kill your ability to transmit light to the sensor. The high transmission concept is real and so is the build quality. This filter is a case of getting what you pay for, but, then again, the Nikkor 24-70 isn't cheap and why would you not want to get the most you can while on location?
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: If you like the look of a CPL, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally use filters, but when I bought my NIKKOR 24-70 f/2.8, I could either pay full price for the lens itself, or pay that same price and get this filter for free. Obviously I took the free filter. lol It works great and the optics are everything you could hope for. I've used it a couple times so far and the images have been very clean. If you like the look of a CPL, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: It is a good quality filter
customer_reviews.text: B&W always has a good quality product. They are a little pricey. The filter showed up in great shape. I wish the manufacturer would tape the box. Over all i am happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: cpeepers

customer_reviews.title: The Mercedes in filter  category
customer_reviews.text: It is the best filter you can get! There is no better that this! I chose this filter for my super sharp Canon 16-35 f4 IS lens to shoot landscape, the result is stunning! Light transmision is alot better than in Hoya
customer_reviews.author: Benja

customer_reviews.title: Superb filter from the best maker
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Fuji X-E1 to put on the [[asin:B016S28I4S XF35 F/2.0] Fujinon lens. It has proven well worth the price in increased color saturation, contrast and glare control. As a bonus, it's a little bit of lens protection. The XF35's lens shade screws right into the front of this filter, so all I have to do to adjust it is turn the lens shade.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: First Rate.
customer_reviews.text: Love the results that these produce. Many younger photographers have not discovered the value of a good CPL filter. The build quality does not change with B&W. My first choice is Heliopan, then B&W. You get what you pay for with these filters. You can count on B&W as well as Heliopan for consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Jiggy955

customer_reviews.title: Yellow cast on photos
customer_reviews.text: This polarizer seems to cast a yellow tint on all my photos. I’m very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: PJ Bark

customer_reviews.title: Nice Filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice filter that is made well. I'd buy it again if I need a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens filter, came with oily film on it.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid, low light loss, effective polarizer lens. Only issue is that they came with some kind of oily film on them and I had to clean the off before using. It cleaned up well with a little care. Also one really tiny spec on the lens. Barely noticeable by the eye and does not affect picture quality, but not what I would expect from one of the higher quality lenses from B+W.
customer_reviews.author: iskiharder

customer_reviews.title: Good for wide angle lenses.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've bought, both for wide angle lense. This one does not turn or twist to adjust as easy as my first one. Seems to stick. Hopefully it will break in with a little use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Tingey

customer_reviews.title: Photos look awesome
customer_reviews.text: The pictures I've taken look amazing. Gray tones can be a little much but yellow (mustard) comes out so nice! My biggest complaint is that it scratched super easy. Kinda not cool for over 100 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos F. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Is this a brand-new one?
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised to receive the filter today, about 1 week ahead of the expected delivery date. I am also surprised that there is a beak-like smudge, about 1 cm in size, on the glass facing the camera lens. It can be easily removed by a piece of cloth and Zeiss cleaning spray, but this is the first time I find a smudge on a filter supposed to be "new".
customer_reviews.author: Li-Kai Wang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filter
customer_reviews.text: Using this on a Canon 90D. Authentic item. Would buy again. Does not offer Bluetooth capability.
customer_reviews.author: H. Giles

customer_reviews.title: B+W Kaesmann filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very expensive filter, well built.It does not enrich colors, reduce glare or darken skies as well as a more conventional CPL. True, one only loses 1 f stop using it, but I will not buy another one of this type.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ellis

customer_reviews.title: ITS REAL NOW👍🏿
customer_reviews.text: I checked and i think Amazon has solved the fake issues. This lens is perfect all though i did not take the glare on the front mirrors i wanted to capture its side profile without the glare. Shot on my 135mm edited with lightroom
customer_reviews.author: Abdallah

customer_reviews.title: #1 lens filter manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy any other lens filters other than the B+W. By far the best filter I’ve ever had on a lens. I felt the need to finally try one when I purchased my new lens just because I’ve had other lens filters break over the smallest of things. Also the glass on B+Ws filters is such a high quality you definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Good Image Transmission
customer_reviews.text: Basically, a good quality circular polarizer - good rotation, smooth operation and quality optics. And, good value.
customer_reviews.author: T G Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great filter with a couple of you should knows...
customer_reviews.text: Great polarizing filter! Quality glass. Very slim. t It is a little difficult to grasp and remove, especially if you have a second filter on the lens. Also, the rim of the filter is larger than my lens cap. So, when I am using this filter I cannot have a lens cap on the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Shuley

customer_reviews.title: Sunny day filter!
customer_reviews.text: totally worth it! U need this in daylight! Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Love

customer_reviews.title: Only kind I use.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing one if the best polarizers you will buy. Dont waste your money with competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wrinkle

product_meta.title: B + W Circular Polarizer Kaesemann - Xtra Slim Mount (XS-PRO), HTC, 16 Layers Multi-Resistant and Nano Coating, Photography Filter, 77 mm
feature_bullets: A MUST-HAVE – Whether you’re indoors or outdoors, the right polarizing filter is a must for every photography equipment. No other filter provides such a simple and fast method for breathtaking pictures through reduced reflections on water and smooth non-metallic surfaces. Enjoy richer colors in landscape photography, outlining clouds, skies, and skylines in perfect clarity.

EASY TO USE CAMERA FILTER - The Käsemann polarization filter can easily be screwed onto the filter thread of most lenses. Thanks to its special design, the adjustment ring can then be rotated on the filter without resistance in order to improve your images in the simplest possible way. You see an immediate result through the camera viewfinder, or on the display. Adjust the effect strength as desired.

BEST WORKMANSHIP - The High Transmission (HTC) polarization film is set between two precise ground and polished cover glasses. It is particularly neutral in color and of high quality, providing for much sharper and richer images than conventional polarizing filters. The MRC glass has been refined with several wafer-thin layers of coating to ensure high scratch resistance and a dirt- and water-repellent effect due to nanotechnology (lotus effect).

TOUGH & SOLID MOUNTS - B+W sockets are absolutely accurate, easy to apply, and easy to adjust as polarizing filters thanks to their precision manufacturing. With an extra narrow XS-PRO mount, vignettes can be ruled out in most cases, even at high wide-angle angles. Due to the internal thread, a conventional lens hood can also be fitted so you can take better pictures.

MADE IN GERMANY - Schneider Kreuznach (B + W) – We’re proudly your precision mechanics specialists for filters, photography, optics and precision, with more than 100 years of German experience. Schneider products have already been used in NASA's Apollo missions. Thanks to our multi-resistant nano coating lens filter, we’re helping photographers everywhere take clearer, crisper images.
